topic.title: Exist a CMS for build site in Zeronet?
Can i create a web site hosted in zeronet but visible on clear net?
topic.body: I want to know if is it possible to create a web site here to be available also "normal internet". I think that can be great.

topic.title: Is it possible to create a over pc?
topic.body: I am curious to know this: is it possible to create a pc with a CPU over 100 core, 256gb ram, 20 tb ssd? I love ZeroNet, here there are polite users

topic.title: How to change a domain on Zeronet?
topic.body: I need to change a domain in my blog with a normal domain. How can i do it?

1575749633_1DfbNohg1UZxEJXMGS4W46bSSh3Ag.body:
> [creative](#comment_3_1J8Z3dnffKkBzmtdNjCUVPa4DWNGPLqn9L): good question, sadly php flat file CMSs will not work.

i had read about hexo cms but i don't know it

> [filips](#comment_336_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Hexo is static website builder, not CMS. It just generates static files, so it can be used with ZeroNet, but does not support dynamic functionalities.

ok thank you. i seen it. by the way is a good idea too

> [filips](#comment_337_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): And just one additional thing: [...]

yes i seen it but i don't know how can i use it. Have to install it on zeronet directory or?

> [filips](#comment_338_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): This depends on which builder you want to use. [...]

ok i will try it, thank you man

1575755429_1DfbNohg1UZxEJXMGS4W46bSSh3Ag.body:
> [fractalzoomer](#comment_33_1CJc7iRKb8yncAkdF29t1M85mhfYEKgAFj): Check out this site. It redirects users to a working zeronet proxy, a server that allows users to view zeronet over a normal internet connection.

In this case i can post on Zeronet but be visible out of the zeroweb. It's a good idea avoid censorship, no?

> [fractalzoomer](#comment_33_1CJc7iRKb8yncAkdF29t1M85mhfYEKgAFj): Check out this site. It redirects users to a working zeronet proxy, a server that allows users to view zeronet over a normal internet connection.

I need to host my site here, to edit it, to update it and to add new post. But i would like to know if it's possibile to link my zeronet blog hosting with my clearnet domain so everyone can read it. Sorry for my english. Thank you.

1575913720_1DfbNohg1UZxEJXMGS4W46bSSh3Ag.body:
> [lianna](#comment_57_16ePf6TBgip2eF88AxhnRJdPXyZJK1V2S4): What exactly do you mean by "domain"? [...]

i mean this "1Duaoanbdsssbb2222" (example) in domain.bit

> [glightstar](#comment_182_14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy): First get a domain through Namecoin https://zeronet.io/docs/faq/#how-can-i-register-a-bit-domain or get a free one at Name.YOThen edit the zite' content.json: https://zeronet.io/docs/site_development/content_json/#domain

thank you

1576066471_16H8PnkKK28GX5NdwsAz6EALB9Quv.body: Wow, tu sei il creatore di TNTVillage oppure un utente che ha trovato i torrent e ha replicato il sito qui?

> [bwcolor](#comment_3_16H8PnkKK28GX5NdwsAz6EALB9QuvoY5bU): non ho fatto nulla io... sto solo condividendo questo progetto

Non sapevo l'avessero messo online. Grazie mille comunque.
